problem_text:
The commutator length cl(g) of g ∈ [G, G] is the least number of commutators in G whose product is g, and the stable commutator length is scl(g) := lim n→∞ cl(g^n)/n.
Conjecture: Let G be a hyperbolic group. Then the stable commutator length takes on rational values on [G, G].
D. Calegari
